name: Physics HL
description: IB Physics develops conceptual understanding and problem-solving skills in mechanics, waves, electricity, magnetism, and modern physics. HL extends into fields, electromagnetism, quantum physics, and astrophysics.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 1
assessmentComponents.description: Multiple choice questions on core and AHL material
assessmentComponents.structure: 40 multiple choice questions. Calculator allowed. Data booklet provided.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 2
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A: Short-answer questions (all compulsory). Section B: Extended response - choose 2 from 3. Section C: Extended response - choose 1 from 2.
markingCriteria: Use data booklet values where appropriate

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 3
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A: Data-based questions testing practical skills. Section B: ONE Option topic with extended questions.

assessmentComponents.name: Internal Assessment
assessmentComponents.description: Individual Investigation - scientific investigation report (6-12 pages)
assessmentComponents.structure: Criteria: Personal engagement (8%), Exploration (25%), Analysis (25%), Evaluation (25%), Communication (17%)

mathsRequirements: Students need proficiency in: algebra, trigonometry, vectors, graphical analysis, differentiation and integration (HL), logarithms, and handling significant figures and uncertainties.
practicalRequirements: Minimum 40 hours of practical work including mechanics experiments, electrical circuits, wave demonstrations, and data analysis with error propagation.
iaGuidelines: The IA should focus on a physics concept with clear measurement and analysis. Topics should allow for good data with calculable uncertainties. Avoid topics that are too complex or lack quantitative analysis.
